definitions.definition: a word or phrase used to describe a thing or to express a concept, especially in a particular kind of language or branch of study.
language used on a particular occasion; a way of expressing oneself.
examples: a protest in the strongest possible terms
synonyms: expressions "a protest in the strongest terms"

definitions.definition: a word or words that may be the subject or predicate of a proposition.
a fixed or limited period for which something, e.g., office, imprisonment, or investment, lasts or is intended to last.
examples: the president is elected for a single four-year term
synonyms: incumbency "the director is elected for a two-year term"

definitions.definition: the duration of a person's life.
examples: duration, length, span the whole term of your natural life

definitions.definition: the completion of a normal length of pregnancy.
examples: noun: full term; plural noun: full terms

definitions.definition: a tenancy of a fixed period.
a boundary or limit, especially of time.
each of the periods in the year, alternating with holidays or vacations, during which instruction is given in a school, college, or university, or during which a court holds sessions.
conditions under which an action may be undertaken or agreement reached; stipulated or agreed-upon requirements.
examples: the union and the company agreed upon the contract's terms

definitions.definition: conditions with regard to payment for something; stated charges.
synonyms: points More"the terms of the contract"rates
fees; tariff "a policy offering more favorable terms"

definitions.definition: agreed conditions under which a war or other dispute is brought to an end.
examples: the United States played a key role in prodding the two sides to come to terms
synonyms: meet each other halfway "the two sides came to terms"

definitions.definition: each of the quantities in a ratio, series, or mathematical expression.
give a descriptive name to; call by a specified name.
examples: he has been termed the father of modern theology
synonyms: nickname; formaldenominate "he has been termed the father of modern theology"
